rushing_attempts.sentence: Dominic Rhodes found the end zone twice, making fantasy owners happy, but managed just 73 yards on 20 carries versus 1 of the league's worst run defenses.

rushing_touchdowns.sentence: Anyone who played the Lions +17 can thank Bob Sanders for sitting out and return man Keiwan Ratliff, who lost 3 fumbles in the first 2.

4.comment: Dominic Rhodes touchdown, I wouldn't have given Detroit a chance to cover. Anyone who played the Lions +17 can thank Bob Sanders for sitting out and return man Keiwan Ratliff, who lost 3 fumbles in the first 2.and-a-half quarters. I had the Lions +17, and it looks like Ratliff did as well. It's always good to have a return specialist on your side.    Looking at the box score, the stat that jumps out at you is Dallas Clark's 12 receptions for 142 yards and a touchdown. Reggie Wayne had 7 catches for 104 yards himself. Marvin Harrison, meanwhile, hauled in just 2 grabs.    Peyton Manning was dominant, as you would expect. He finished 28-of-37 for 318 yards and 1 touchdown. Dominic Rhodes, meanwhile, playing for the injured Joseph Addai, rushed for 86 yards and 2 touchdowns on 20 carries.    Despite having a dimensionally challenged quarterback with an injured thumb throwing to him, Rhodes touchdown, I wouldn't have given Detroit a chance to cover. 8.comment: Dominic Rhodes (14-33) each achieved an unexpected first down in that situation. Unfortunately for Indianapolis, the team went to the well 1 too many times. They failed on their final attempt, forcing to settle for a field goal. Speaking of a poor coaching decision, what was Jim Caldwell doing when he called a timeout with 29 seconds remaining in regulation amid a running clock? Instead of being forced into an unfavorable 50-yard field goal, the Jets were able to run another play - which is when Sanchez hit Edwards for 18 yards along the sideline. <div class=dfpAdSlots>   Rhodes (14-33) each achieved an unexpected first down in that situation. Unfortunately for Indianapolis, the team went to the well 1 too many times. They failed on their final attempt, forcing to settle for a field goal. Speaking of a poor coaching decision, what was Jim Caldwell doing when he called a timeout with 29 seconds remaining in regulation amid a running clock? Instead of being forced into an unfavorable 50-yard field goal, the Jets were able to run another play - which is when Sanchez hit Edwards for 18 yards along the sideline. <div class=dfpAdSlots>
